title: Glanum
description: Glanum was a Celtic oppidum that became a Roman city; it was eventually abandoned in the third century AD.

properties.description: 1:500,000 scale representative point location digitized from the Barrington Atlas of the Greek and Roman World by the Digital Atlas of Roman and Medieval Civilizations project at Harvard University.
properties.title: DARMC location 6382

properties.description: The mausoleum of the three Julii brothers, ca. 40 BC. Location based on OpenStreetMap
properties.title: OSM location of Mausoleum of the Julii

properties.description: A Roman triumphal arch built in the early first century AD. Location based on OpenStreetMap
properties.title: location of the Triumphal Arch of Glanum
